If the temperature on the ground is \displaystyle{61}^{\circ}, what will it be at 6500 feet above ground level?
Answers should be rounded to the units place.

solution.p: The model for this situation is \displaystyle{T}_{{A}}={61}-\frac{{{3.5}}}{{{1000}}}{A}.
Because we want to estimate the temperature at 6500 ft AGL, we calculate \displaystyle{T}_{{A}}={61}-\frac{{{3.5}}}{{{1000}}}{6500}={38.25}\approx{38}
